Here you can write down any pieces of text from the literature you deem interesting or that we could use in our paper.

[104]. It was concluded in [104] that in general, if in a given sensor network and distributed algorithm, the average number of hops to the central processor exceeds the necessary number of iterations, then the distributed algorithm will be more energy-efficient than a typical centralized algorithm.

Localization schemes for wireless ad hoc networks can be classified as either range-based or connectivity-based depending on what information (e.g., distance and angle measurements or proximity contraints) is used to provide position estimation.
